alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Carroll, central Jo Daviess, central Jackson and southeastern Dubuque Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 926 PM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm over Green Island, or 16 miles west of Mount Carroll, moving northwest at 15 mph. At 913 PM, public spotters reported hail around the size of nickels to quarters, but the storm has weakened since then. Still, the storm is capable of hail the pennies. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and penny size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hanover around 930 PM CDT. Bellevue around 945 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforcement.
